title: I think Sivir could use a little lovetap
body:
Sure Sivir isn't the worst ADC at the moment. She still has a meh winrate, and is still Sivir so she's still really useful.

But overall she's come out of the preseason a little...lackluster. None of the keystones really work with her. Most people have noticed her feeling kinda weakish and her playrate has dropped by quite a bit.

My proposal is simple: Allow her W bounces to proc spell effects.

This would allow Sivir to proc deathfire touch with her W, proc thunderlords with her W, stack fervor with her W. It would also allow her W to proc rylais, proc spell vamp, proc liandrys, and other similar effects. But nobody plays AP sivir, so we don't care about that. Allowing Sivir to proc spell effects on her W would make keystones sync with her, and she would be a good ADC once more.

replies.body:
Yeah, this season's been a bit rough on Sivir. We're going to be testing some changes to her shortly and are planning on helping out subsequent W bounces. Current thinking is towards allowing W bounces to crit, since that goes well with the AD itemization that's otherwise appealing to Sivir. On hit effects would certainly be cool, but adds a lot of power in some cases and would require Sivir be balanced around the most optimal cases. 

As far as Sivir's strategic niche goes the ult's always been a big part of that. Strong wave clear and reasonable team fight AOE are also intended strengths though, so this change supports that well. She's meant to be weak as a duelest too, so W bounce buffs as you've identified are potentially a really good fit.
Would each bounce follow individual rng crit chance, or would they all crit if the first bounce crits (and vice versa)? Sounds neat either way.
Independent crit chance most likely.

Would they be reduced crits as well?

I feel like full crits may get really silly really fast.
I know you're asking from a good place, but let's just go ahead and assume Riot will _probably_ think of such a possibility, and balance accordingly, eh?

Honestly i have seen Rito make some pretty questionable changes.

So it never hurts to ask.

Jinx has full crits, that deal 10% increased damage, with a much longer range, and she gets more than 3 of them AND they don't have a travel time between targets.

Its also limited to a small AOE radius and doesn't constantly bounce to every enemy in range.

If we count the bounces Sivir's W has potentially infinite range whereas Jinx requires the target to be somewhat close to her original target to get hit by the AOE. and the crit.

Just throwing it out there, but I thought when she was initially being re-worked one of the ideas was she would be more about flat AD and CDR? Could she not be worked in a Jhin sort of way to use crit in some other way?

You already want to build CDR on Sivir for the Ult, and everything else really. They all benefit.

Flat damage currently benefits Q and W hugely.

But then you drop into crit and it seems wasteful. If you allow the W to crit, the Q seems left out. It was once the largest damage non-ult in the game (if it hit only one target twice), but it's lost that with all the new scaling. If the W is getting crit-love, could the Q get it's chunky single target damage back?

For instance, back-load the damage to the second hit of the Q, so the first hit "marks" them, and being hit by the return pops the mark and deals the heavy portion of the damage, allowing them to dodge (unless caught at the end of the boomerang). If they are only hit by the return, it's just the first-hit damage instead. The idea being that you must hit twice for the big deeps. This would make the boomerang more mechanically interesting too.
So, if I understand this correctly, this would make absolutely zero difference in DPS for 1vs1 right?
Correct, if it's a straight 1v1 with no other enemies around this wouldn't affect anything.

As a platinum ELO Sivir main (~800 games on her last season + S4 on NA server), I think the big problem with Sivir right now is that her W does not proc Thnderlords or Deathfire Touch.  Her W should apply on hit effects like Black Cleaver and such, but for some reason it doesn't do much besides bounce and do a small amount of damage.  Her consistency is good (it's hard not to be consistent with her ulti), and she doesn't need much more to be a top tier ADC, her W just needs to be treated like every other skill in the game.  I say this, given that in my few ranked games this season, I am 6-0 on Sivir, with close to a 5.0 KDA.  She's just as strong as always, but if she wants to top the charts, her W needs to be a real skill.

Her W actually does proc Black Cleaver.

But then again, Black Cleaver isn't an on-hit effect, it's an on-physical damage and Sivir W deals physical damage, so that makes sense.

Although it's honestly a surprise to hear that her W doesn't count as a skill, considering it's a flat-out superior version of Ravenous Hydra in many ways, on a ranged hero. Sure, it doesn't proc lifesteal and it's not on literally every attack ( although 40% CDR can make it pretty damn close ), but it has more AoE, doesn't have damage decaying based on distance, and doesn't cost any gold.

And that's not even considering it actually does more damage than Hydra after all of two skill points in it. The first makes it deal equal damage.

What about giving Sivir a unique item (boomerang) like Viktor. That would empower her abilities in different ways. One boomerang gives her Q a minor slow and her W one extra or empowered attack. Another lengthens the range of Q and makes her E last 1s longer (although her spell shield doesn't really correlate with her boomerang, let's assume it's a magical one). Another gives her a MS bonus when her Q is out (think Ahri) and a minor slow on her W. Maybe one boomerang empowers her W to do extra damage on structures (towers, etc.). Some simple ideas. 

I love the physics of flying objects and boomerangs are some of the coolest flying objects. Design is EVERYTHING in how a boomerang flies, so if she chose between different boomerangs to use per game it could fit quite well.

Additionally, this gives her great strategic advantage in playing into different matchups. Against a poke comp she may go for longer range to combat that. Against a hi CC comp she may go for longer E duration or maybe it's a reduced CD. 

Give her more versatility in her utility.

The issue is her ult is so retardedly good that riot wants that to be the reason you play. If they up her damage or anything, then she will have that godlike ult and all that damage and outclass other adcs.

If her ult was supposed to be the only reason that Sivir is picked then she'd be a support. Sivir is supposed to be a major teamfight ADC, like MF, except instead of wombo her teamfight is run the enemy down with her ult and deal massive AOE damage. 

Sivir is supposed to deal a lot of AOE damage, not as much as MF or Twitch, but still more than most other ADCs like Vayne and Lucian. This would let the masteries support that, which they currently do not.

Not quite. She outputs high damage, and high aoe damage at that. But the Main reason she is chosen is that ult. If you want aoe, you go miss fortune or twitch. Even graves. Maybe even jinx. You want single target, go vayne, Lucian, koggy. She does high damage, but she provides far more utility than any of those adcs could ever hope to. It's why she was so heavily played last season, and why she received victorious. She can careen her team's engage right into theirs at a moments notice and often wipe a team fight because of how sudden it is. Similarly she can disengage her whole team from a misplay or enemy engage.

> she provides far more utility than any of those adcs could ever hope to.

Ashe and ADC kennen would like a word with you. But otherwise, I completely agree. But her ult was nerfed so she COULD use a small damage buff.
Ashe can make picks, but her utility isn't quite what Sivir can bring to the team. ADC Kennan is more niche and far too risky for what he brings. Sivir still out classes them in pure engage utility.

Ashe has more utility in the form of kiting and about equal in terms of Engage. Sivir has more utility in the Lulu sense, she buffs up her teammates engage. 

Kennen provides a lot of secondary engage and a fairly safe lane. 

I think it's just different types of utility.

I wouldn't say her engage is on par. It's a single target stun that can be mitigated by popular meta picks like Banshees Veil, Yasuo, or any tank. Also since MEcurial scimitar was buffed, many ADs are running QSS now. I'd consider Ashe having some more direct picking power situationally, however Sivir can crash her front line into your team in a matter of a second or two every time. She can also disengage while Ashe can only stun someone and maybe slow a couple very briefly. 

However, yes. Ashe seems mrore of a single target utility based ADC while Sivir is an aoe based utility ADC.

Kennen just seems off. Very niche, not someone you can just take into a game and do well with. 


Point is, I think the on hit is a bit much. Think about fervor. She would stack it fully in a couple autos or even one if there were enough things around. Sivir's damage to champions would rocket if she applied DFT every time her ricochet touched someone. Red buff being applied to all, team wide slowing and burning for true damage just sounds horrific. 

And definitely no on hits. Or else you'll have on hit sivir being played having every bounce deal 300+ to other champs in a team fight per auto.

Sivir is currently rather "Meh" for a simple reason:

In the preseason, her base AS was nerfed harshly, from 0.66 to 0.625.

That nerf hit her hard, for the simple reason that the majority of her damage relies on auto-attacks (only Q is auto-independent). Revert it (at least partially), and it'll go a long way towards improving her performance.
Did someone say "Love tap"? {{champion:21}}

I really enjoy sivr atm, and don't find her weak. I might be the only one, but she's my go-to adc, and I haven't had any issues with her. Her waveclear is unparalleled, and to me she feels pretty strong at all stages of the game.
i think sivir is the worst adc right now. worse than kog and ashe. her mana costs are abysmmal. and  she doesn't have as much of a single target focus or steroid like other adcs.
Well she also has an amazing mana regen mechanic. That's why her mama costs are high.
It's a very situational mana regen mechanic at best. A smart support won't just throw spells willy-nilly and regen all of sivir's mana.

If they never throw a spell at you, then you can do whatever you want in that lane... Most of the Supports today have only one powerful spell with heavy CC, and the other spells are working only when you combo them perfectly. If the enemy Support doesn't want to use that powerful CC to engage, than he/she can be easly ignored.

One more thing to note is that Sivir isn't forced at all to play passively. If she wants to engage, you either do something, or you just Auto-Attack a champion that can do loads of damage in a short trade.

Honestly, the issue with that is you would be taking even more free damage just for being against a sivir in lane, with little you can do about it.   Think about it this way, she is pretty much ensured the 3 hits time around with her W, so that means she will be chunking you with a Thunderlord proc each and every wave.  Most champs have to actually fight for them now, but Sivir would just be getting them by accident by pushing.
its actaully pretty damn simple to not stand next to the minions when its coming your way....probably the easiest spell to dodge....lol

The bounce range is pretty large, but prioritizes closer targets.   If Sivir times it to when the enemy is approaching her wave to CS, you will probably get 1-2 of them to hit you just because it runs out of targets.  Sure, right now it is only irritating, but if she could combo it with a near free TL proc?  That is an extra 10-60 damage just in lane.  She has effectively negated passive regeneration just with the TL procs, without her having invested much effort.   Combo with a quick Q if she sees a bounce heading to you, and she has her proc in the OP's situation almost without fail.   Also, there are still other situations where OP's change would be powerful.  If her W could apply spell effects, it could apply things like BC's shred and speed boost.    You know how much I want that to happen?  "Oh, I W'd a wave, now I have massive MS for the next 4 seconds or so."


Seriously, lets retune her base AS, which was gutted for some reason, then we can go back to her W bounces doing extra stuff for free.  It just is one of the worst places to add power to her kit, because it is nearly 100% invisible, is going to happen almost every lane without her trying, and doesn't change her playstyle at all or give her any more reason to fight you (Hell, if anything, it rewards her more for playing passive and getting the TL procs and the like without putting herself at risk).
Sivir's W already applies BC. BC is on dealing physical damage.

Lets just say, I'm a smart Sivir, and I'm paired with a hook support.  I press W, and now have several seconds where you really don't want to be near your minion wave.  What can my support now do?  Yes, you can dodge the hook, but I just made it far easier for him to land it.

The changes to AD itemization hurt Siv since she scaled best of raw AD and armor pen.

Allowing her bounces and Q to Crit (at some reduced value no doubt) would let her function in this new world of 'Go crit or go home' ADCs.
Please don't forget the base AS nerf that came with the preseason.

Sivir definitely needs some love, and while this would be a welcome change, I'm not sure it would really solve her problems. She's a squishy, short ranged adc with no instant repositioning. Her abilities fix those problems, but she has no reliable way to regenerate mana, especially since essence reaver only works when you're critting stuff. Manamune fixes this, but takes so long to get built up and neuters her early and mid game to stack a tear. 

She has too many weaknesses for her few strengths. I'd honestly prefer just having more ability to use what she already has.

Sivir is the biggest reason why I miss mana potions. I used to buy 2-3 of them every single back. 

I do think that ER helps a lot with her mana issues though, and so does her E. The preseason changes feel like she can't really bully lane anymore due to her extreme costs. Mana issues are probably the other reason why I've stopped playing Sivir anywhere near as much as I used to.

But regardless of strength satisfaction is also something to be looked at. And Sivir not working well with any of the keystones is very unsatisfying :/
